Description: A feature of this watchcase is the exceptional chasing and embossing executed by a London embosser who signed his work: "Parbury fec[it]."  George Graham of London was largely responsible for technical innovations that assured British watchmakers their preeminence in Europe during the second quarter of the 18th century.  Depicted is the marriage of Zephyrus, god of the west wind, and Flora, goddess of flowering plants.

Provenance: Anatole Demidoff, Prince of San Donato (1812-1870);  Tiffany and Co., New York prior to 1893 [mode of acquisition unknown] (on 1893 list, no. 83);  Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown];  Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: Cylinder Watch in Double Case Depicting the Marriage of  Zephyrus and Flora
